1.brief: properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
Asaph, the name of three Israelites, and of the family of the first
a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
the heart (as the most interior organ);

2.brief: a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
a foot (as used in walking); by implication, a step; by euphemistically the pudenda
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
to spill forth (blood, a libation, liquid metal; or even a solid, i.e. to mound up); also (figuratively) to expend (life, soul, complaint, money, etc.); intensively, to sprawl out

3.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (causatively, make) zealous, i.e. (in a bad sense) jealous or envious
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
safe, i.e. (figuratively) well, happy, friendly; also (abstractly) welfare, i.e. health, prosperity, peace
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

4.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
the body (as being rolled together); also powerful

5.brief: toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
a man in general (singly or collectively)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)

6.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to collar, i.e. adorn with anecklace; figuratively, to fit out with supplies
arrogance or majesty; by implication, (concretely) ornament
to shroud, i.e. clothe (whether transitive or reflex.); hence (from the idea of darkness) to languish
violence; by implication, wrong; by meton. unjust gain

7.brief: to go (causatively, bring) out, in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively, direct and proxim.
fat, whether literally or figuratively; hence, the richest or choice part
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a figure (carved on stone, the wall, or any object); figuratively, imagination
the heart (as the most interior organ);

8.brief: perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
altitude, i.e. concretely (an elevated place), abstractly (elevation, figuratively (elation), or adverbially (aloft)
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

9.brief: to place, i.e. array; reflex. to lie
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

10.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
water; figuratively, juice; by euphemism, urine, semen
full (literally or figuratively) or filling (literally); also (concretely) fulness; adverbially, fully
to suck out; by implication, to drain, to squeeze out

11.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
there is or are (or any other form of the verb to be, as may suit the connection)
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme

12.brief: morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
tranquil; (in a bad sense) careless; abstractly, security
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
probably a force, whether of men, means or other resources; an army, wealth, virtue, valor, strength

13.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
emptiness; figuratively, a worthless thing; adverbially, in vain
to be translucent; figuratively, to be innocent
the heart (as the most interior organ);
to lave (the whole or a part of a thing)
the hollow hand or palm (so of the paw of an animal, of the sole, and even of the bowl of a dish or sling, the handle of a bolt, the leaves of a palm-tree); figuratively, power

14.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

properly, to touch, i.e. lay the hand upon (for any purpose; euphemistically, to lie with a woman); by implication, to reach (figuratively, to arrive, acquire); violently, to strike (punish, defeat, destroy, etc.)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning

15.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
properly, a revolution of time, i.e. an age or generation; also a dwelling
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to cover (with a garment); figuratively, to act covertly; by implication, to pillage

16.brief: properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

17.brief: as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a consecrated thing or place, especially, a palace, sanctuary (whether of Jehovah or of idols) or asylum
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)
to separate mentally (or distinguish), i.e.(generally) understand
the last or end, hence, the future; also posterity

18.brief: a particle of affirmation, surely; hence (by limitation) only
properly, smoothness; figuratively, flattery; also an allotment
to place (in a very wide application)
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)

19.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time
to complete, in a good or a bad sense, literal, or figurative, transitive or intransitive
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

20.brief: the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
a phantom, i.e. (figuratively) illusion, resemblance; hence, a representative figure, especially an idol

21.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be pungent; i.e. in taste (sour, i.e. literally fermented, or figuratively, harsh), in color (dazzling)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
a kidney (as an essential organ); figuratively, the mind (as the interior self)
to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate

22.brief: properly, foot (as consumed); i.e. (by exten.) of cattle brutishness; (concretely) stupid
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
properly, a dumb beast; especially any large quadruped or animal (often collective)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)

23.brief: properly, continuance (as indefinite extension); but used only (attributively as adjective) constant (or adverbially, constantly); ellipt. the regular (daily) sacrifice
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to seize (often with the accessory idea of holding in possession)
a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

24.brief: advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
to guide; by implication, to transport (into exile, or as colonists)
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
to take (in the widest variety of applications)

25.brief: who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
the sky (as aloft; the dual perhaps alluding to the visible arch in which the clouds move, as well as to the higher ether where the celestial bodies revolve)
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

26.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
flesh (as swelling out), as living or forfood; generally food of any kind; figuratively, kindred by blood
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, a cliff (or sharp rock, as compressed); generally, a rock or boulder; figuratively, a refuge; also an edge (as precipitous)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

27.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

to commit adultery (usually of the female, and less often of simple fornication, rarely of involuntary ravishment); figuratively, to commit idolatry (the Jewish people being regarded as the spouse of Jehovah)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses

28.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to place (in a very wide application)
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, deputyship, i.e. ministry; generally, employment (never servile) or work (abstractly or concretely); also property (as the result of labor)
